chapter.title: Reader concept
chapter.p: A concept used by the library algorihms to read logical sequence of elements of type ElementT element by element. It is a generalization and rework of the InputIterator concept. In particular it better handles streams, NULL-terminated strings and other sequences where end-iterator is meaningless or expensive to obtain. At the same time, traditional [begin,end) pair of iterators is just a particular case and fully and well handled by __vic::range_reader adapter.
When the particular class meets the requirements of this concept for some ElementT = T it is said to model the Reader<T> concept.
Each instance of the class has to be move- or copy-constructible.

synopsis.p: Attempts to get the next element of the sequence. Returns true and places the value to v on success. Returns false if no element available (EOF). Throws an exception in other cases.
